channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot hole big enough to pop a tyre, 30th May
item.description:
As you turn into Lambert gardens from the Shurdington road the hole is on the driving line of the passengers side, followed by very rough 2 ft long area on the drivers driving line.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Lambert Gardens, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole from previous poor repair job. Hazardous to cyclists, 30th May
item.description:
I hit this pothole whist cyling. I was concentrating on a bus coming the other way so didn't notice it in time to take any avoiding action. The impact was significant and it could cause a cyclist to lose control and go under a bus.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken slabs, 30th May
item.description:
Need repairijg

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monson Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge encroachment, 30th May
item.description:
Silt /mudis washing down the hill and settling outside 6 Gopshill Lane ... the grass verge is encroaching onto the roadway and likely contributing the blocked drain (reported separately)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gopshill Lane, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Block drain, 30th May
item.description:
Block drain outside 6 Gopshill Lane causing flooding down the lane, and potholes as a result.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gopshill Lane, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 pot holes, 30th May
item.description:
On Gopshill Lane between Tythe Farm & 6 Gopshill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gopshill Lane, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous directional sign, 30th May
item.description:
Bottom section of 4 piece directional sign has dropped to a level that could quite easily impact the head of a tall person waking or running past. I have lived near this sign for over 7 years and in that time it has almost permanently been in a state of disarray. Maybe tightening old/existing brackets is not the solution. Try a new bracket or something.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th May
item.description:
Overgrown tree branches at height, over phone lines.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep hole around the road casing of the Drain in/around this area., 30th May
item.description:
Road Drain around the area shown, deep hole has opened up around the casing of the metal drain. It's on a corner so avoiding it pushes you onto oncoming traffic... not good. Been there for the past week at least. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Footways Slabs problem, 30th May
item.description:
28 day give and take Temporary footway closure Please remove x 2 600 x 600 x 25 and x 1 900 x 600 x 25 Slab and replace with tarmac patch Due to vehicle overiding (FW Broken Slabs)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 30th May
item.description:
28 day with give and take Temporary footway closure needed Please remove 4 x 900 x 600 x 25 and 2 x 750 x 600 x 25 and 4 x 600 x 600 x 25, and replace with tarmac due to tree roots damage. (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The footpath is dangerously narrow because the verge is encroaching it., 30th May
item.description:
The whole stretch between Twigworth Fields and Down Hatherley Lane. As there is no footpath on the other side of the road, people are forced to walk with their back to oncoming traffic in a 50 mph zone on a narrowing footpath just inches from the road. This problem has been ongoing for over 3 years as the verge increasingly takes over the footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Twigworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
